On his Twitter account on Thursday, Eric Schmidt wrote: Day-to-day adult supervision is no longer needed. `` I believe Larry is ready'' to take over as CEO, Eric Schmidt said during a call with analysts.`` It's time for him to have a shot at running this.''

, how will this one stand out? According to Simon Cowell , this show is the only one`` where the contestants take an active role in deciding who's in the band,'' he said. Whereas contestants must sing in different genres on other shows, this is all about Country music. Our contestants will turn some world renowned songs from other genres like Pop or Motown, pour their soul into it and make it Country. The contestants will attempt to win over celebrity guests each week by competing in music business challenges and performing. Every week a contestant will get the boot, but the viewers will determine who gets to win

as the company diversified.`` Larry, Sergey Brin and I have been talking for a long time about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making,'' he said. For the last 10 years, we have all been equally involved in making decisions. This triumvirate approach has real benefits in terms of shared wisdom, and we will continue to discuss the big decisions among the three of us. But we have also agreed to clarify our individual roles so there's clear responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. Eric Schmidt , formerly CEO of Novell and CTO at Sun Microsystems, had quit his position on the board of Apple in 2009 due to a growing conflict of interest with his role at Google.
